title: What Does a Grey Arrow Mean on Snapchat? Snapchat Arrows Explained

steps.title: Friend request pending.
steps.content: Friend request pending. If youâ€™ve sent a Snap to someone youâ€™ve recently sent a friend request to and a grey arrow appears, it means they havenâ€™t accepted your friend request yet. â€œPendingâ€ and a filled-in grey arrow will appear under this personâ€™s name. Once they accept your request, your Snap will send and the arrow will turn blue. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Removed from friends list.
steps.content: Removed from friends list. Suppose your Snap says it was delivered, but a grey arrow appears. In this case, it could be because theyâ€™ve deleted your Snapchat contact information or have changed their settings to only receive Snaps from friends. They probably received the Snap but removed you from their list without opening it. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Blocked.
steps.content: Blocked. If you send a friend a Snap and a grey arrow and â€œPendingâ€ appear by their contact, it may be because theyâ€™ve blocked you. Check to see if youâ€™re still friends by searching their username in Snapchatâ€™s search bar. If their name pops up, theyâ€™ve unfriended you. If nothing comes up, theyâ€™ve blocked you. [3] X Research source

steps.title: The grey arrow isnâ€™t the only arrow that appears when you send a Snap.
steps.content: The grey arrow isnâ€™t the only arrow that appears when you send a Snap. There are two types of arrows on Snapchat: opened and sent. An opened arrow icon is a colored outline of an arrow and means that a friend has opened your message. A sent arrow icon is a filled-in colored icon that shows your Snap was delivered. Here is what each colored arrow represents: [4] X Research source Purple: A Snap with audio Blue: A Chat Red: A Snap without audio

steps.title: Snapchat icons tell the status of your Snap.
steps.content: Snapchat icons tell the status of your Snap. There are squares, speech bubbles, double arrows, and replay signs along with arrows. These icons appear underneath a username when theyâ€™ve interacted with your Snap. Hereâ€™s a simple guide to help you learn what each icon means: [5] X Research source Red solid square: Sent a Snap without audio Red unfilled square: You viewed a Snap without audio Red double unfilled arrows: Friend took a screenshot of a Snap without audio Red replay: Friend replayed a Snap without audio Purple solid square: Sent a Snap with audio Purple unfilled square: You viewed a Snap with audio Purple double unfilled arrows: Friend took a screenshot of a Snap with audio Purple replay: Friend replayed a Snap with audio Blue solid square: Sent a Chat message Blue unfilled square: You opened a Chat message Blue double unfilled arrows: Friend took a screenshot of a Chat

steps.title: On Snapchat, your friendship status is displayed with fun emojis.
steps.content: On Snapchat, your friendship status is displayed with fun emojis. The number of times you Snap and Chat with a friend can boost or lower your friendship level. To see how close you and a friend are on the app, check if one of these emojis is by their username: [6] X Research source ğŸ’›: BFFs (you send the most Snaps to each other) â¤ï¸: BFFs for two weeks straight ğŸ’•: BFFs for two months straight ğŸ˜: Youâ€™re one of their BFFs, but theyâ€™re not one of yours ğŸ˜: One of your BFFs is their BFF ğŸ˜Š: You send a lot of Snaps to each other ğŸ”¥: Snapstreak (Snapped every day for at least three days) ğŸ’¯: 100-day Snapstreak âŒ›: Snapstreak is about to end ğŸ˜¬: Same BFF ğŸ‚: Birthday ğŸ‘¶: New friend
